title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Use checklist setting new package template.

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Create repository template Clone repository local machine Rename packagename.Rproj yourpackage.Rproj

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Replace packagename actual package name : DESCRIPTION .Rbuildignore (2 instances) .gitignore (3 instances) README.Rmd (multiple instances) pkgdown/_pkgdown.yml .github/CONTRIBUTING.md .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/issue_template.md R/packagename-package.R (rename file update content) tests/testthat.R

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Update Title DESCRIPTION Update Authors@R DESCRIPTION Update Description DESCRIPTION Update URL DESCRIPTION Update BugReports DESCRIPTION Review update dependencies DESCRIPTION

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Update README.Rmd package description Update examples README.Rmd Render README: rmarkdown::render("README.Rmd") Update NEWS.md initial version info Update package description R/packagename-package.R

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Remove example function R/example_function.R (keep reference) Add R functions R/ directory Add roxygen2 documentation functions Generate documentation: devtools::document() Remove example test tests/testthat/test-example_function.R Add tests tests/testthat/ Run tests: devtools::test()

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Add package data data/ directory Create data processing scripts data-raw/ Update create vignettes vignettes/ Add example files inst/extdata/ Update inst/WORDLIST package-specific terms

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Run devtools::check() - pass errors, warnings, notes Run spelling::spell_check_package() - fix typos Run lintr::lint_package() - address style issues Check test coverage: covr::package_coverage() - aim >80%

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Enable GitHub Actions repository settings Set Codecov (optional): add CODECOV_TOKEN secret Enable GitHub Pages pkgdown site Create initial release/tag ready Add repository topics/tags

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Update pkgdown/_pkgdown.yml package structure Organize functions logical groups reference section Add/remove vignettes articles section Customize theme desired Build site locally: pkgdown::build_site()

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Review files template placeholders Commit changes Push GitHub Verify GitHub Actions workflows run successfully Check pkgdown site deployed correctly Create first issue/milestone development Invite collaborators applicable

title: Package Setup Checklist
text: Complete comprehensive testing Review documentation Update version 0.1.0 (1.0.0) Update NEWS.md release notes Create GitHub release Consider submitting CRAN (applicable) Tip: Keep checklist repository development. Delete first release.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement . complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to packagename
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See tidyverse guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to packagename
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UCD-SERG/packagename", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. changes conform tidyverse code style guidelines design principles described . user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html. GitHub automatically check PR see package still functional Mac OS, Windows, Linux; , receive email describing problems. help decoding errors, try resource: https://github.com/r-lib/actions?tab=readme-ov-file#--find-help.

title: Contributing to packagename
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide design principles. can use lintr package automatically check style design issues styler package automatically correct issues. Please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to packagename
text: Please note project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Using This Template

title: Using This Template
text: Create new repository template Click “Use template” GitHub Name new repository (e.g., mypackage) Clone new repository Rename package Replace packagename actual package name files: DESCRIPTION .Rbuildignore .gitignore README.Rmd pkgdown/_pkgdown.yml .github/CONTRIBUTING.md .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/issue_template.md Rename packagename.Rproj yourpackage.Rproj Update package metadata Edit DESCRIPTION: Update Title, Version, Authors@R Update Description Update URL BugReports Add/remove dependencies needed Update README Edit README.Rmd: Update package name description Add examples Run rmarkdown::render("README.Rmd") generate README.md Add code Add R functions R/ directory Add roxygen2 comments function Run devtools::document() generate documentation Add tests Add test files tests/testthat/ Name test files test-*.R Run devtools::test() run tests

title: Using This Template
code: # Install development tools install.packages(c("devtools", "roxygen2", "testthat", "knitr"))  # Install all dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps()  # Load your package for development devtools::load_all()

title: Using This Template
text: Create new R file R/ directory Add roxygen2 documentation function: Generate documentation: devtools::document()
code: #' Function Title #' #' Function description. #' #' @param x Description of parameter x #' @return Description of return value #' @export #' @examples #' my_function(1:10) my_function <- function(x) {   # function body }

title: Using This Template
text: Create test file tests/testthat/test-myfunction.R Add tests using testthat syntax: Run tests: devtools::test()
code: test_that("my_function works correctly", {   result <- my_function(1:10)   expect_equal(result, expected_value) })

title: Using This Template
text: template includes workflows: R-CMD-check: Checks package multiple platforms test-coverage: Computes test coverage pkgdown: Builds deploys documentation website check-readme: Ensures README.md date check-spelling: Checks spelling documentation lint-changed-files: Lints code pull requests news: Checks NEWS.md updated version-check: Ensures version incremented pr-commands: Allows /document /style commands PRs R-check-docs: Ensures documentation date copilot-setup-steps: Configures GitHub Copilot environment

title: Using This Template
text: pkgdown workflow automatically posts comment pull requests link preview documentation. comment behavior can configured .github/workflows/pkgdown.yaml: Current configuration (recommended): Alternative options: Deletes existing preview comment Creates new comment bottom PR conversation Ensures preview link always visible never gets hidden collapsed sections Best : Keeping preview easily accessible long PR conversations Updates existing comment place Comment stays original position conversation May get hidden GitHub collapses old comments long threads Best : Minimal comment clutter, preview may become hard find Choose recreate: true want preview link always visible end PR conversation, append: false prefer minimize number comments don’t mind searching preview link.
code: - name: Notify pkgdown deployment   uses: hasura/comment-progress@v2.2.0   with:     id: pkgdown-deploy     recreate: true  # Deletes old comment and creates new one at bottom of PR

title: Using This Template
text: Follow tidyverse style guide: Use styler::style_pkg() format code Write tests exported functions: Aim >80% coverage Update NEWS.md: Document user-facing changes Increment version: Update version DESCRIPTION PR Use roxygen2 markdown: Enable markdown roxygen comments Add examples: Include working examples function documentation Keep functions focused: One function one thing well

title: Advanced Quarto Article
text: article demonstrates advanced features Quarto pkgdown articles. Unlike vignettes, articles available pkgdown website included package bundle.

what: When to Use Articles vs Vignettes
title: Advanced Quarto Article
text: Vignettes used : Core package documentation Essential usage examples Content users need offline Articles better : Extended tutorials Case studies detailed examples Content large datasets external dependencies Supplementary material

title: Advanced Quarto Article
text: Quarto makes easy create cross-references. example, see Figure 1 scatter plot Table 1 summary table. Figure 1: Scatter plot demonstrating cross-referencing Table 1: Summary statistics example data shown Table 1, variables similar distributions. can make code chunks foldable: Plot View Summary View Raw Data  Important Considerations using package production: Always validate input data Check missing values Consider computational complexity Performance Warning Large datasets may require additional memory processing time. Left Column demonstrates two-column layout Quarto. Feature 1 Feature 2 Feature 3 Right Column can place different content column.
code: # Generate sample data set.seed(123) x <- rnorm(100) y <- 2 * x + rnorm(100, 0, 0.5)  # Create scatter plot plot(x, y,       main = "Example Scatter Plot",      xlab = "X Variable",      ylab = "Y Variable",      pch = 16,      col = rgb(0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.6)) abline(lm(y ~ x), col = "red", lwd = 2) data_summary <- data.frame(   Statistic = c("Mean", "Median", "SD", "Min", "Max"),   X = c(mean(x), median(x), sd(x), min(x), max(x)),   Y = c(mean(y), median(y), sd(y), min(y), max(y)) )  knitr::kable(data_summary, digits = 3) # Prepare more complex data complex_data <- data.frame(   id = 1:50,   group = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 25),   value1 = rnorm(50, 100, 15),   value2 = rnorm(50, 50, 10) )  # Calculate group statistics group_stats <- aggregate(   cbind(value1, value2) ~ group,    data = complex_data,    FUN = function(x) c(mean = mean(x), sd = sd(x)) )  print(group_stats) #>   group value1.mean value1.sd value2.mean value2.sd #> 1     A   101.61247  14.63952   51.727220 10.047051 #> 2     B    98.13191  13.84514   53.261796  8.934998 #>        id           group               value1           value2 #>  Min.   : 1.00   Length:50          Min.   : 79.60   Min.   :32.43 #>  1st Qu.:13.25   Class :character   1st Qu.: 89.29   1st Qu.:46.76 #>  Median :25.50   Mode  :character   Median : 96.64   Median :51.04 #>  Mean   :25.50                      Mean   : 99.87   Mean   :52.49 #>  3rd Qu.:37.75                      3rd Qu.:107.93   3rd Qu.:59.34 #>  Max.   :50.00                      Max.   :132.98   Max.   :72.93 #>    id group    value1   value2 #> 1   1     A 132.98216 46.24397 #> 2   2     A 119.68619 44.38124 #> 3   3     A  96.02282 46.56083 #> 4   4     A 108.14791 50.90497 #> 5   5     A  93.78490 65.98509 #> 6   6     A  92.85630 49.11435 #> 7   7     A  88.17096 60.80799 #> 8   8     A  91.08074 56.30754 #> 9   9     A 124.76361 48.86360 #> 10 10     A  99.18958 34.67098

title: Advanced Quarto Article

title: Advanced Quarto Article
text: can make code chunks foldable:
code: # Prepare more complex data complex_data <- data.frame(   id = 1:50,   group = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 25),   value1 = rnorm(50, 100, 15),   value2 = rnorm(50, 50, 10) )  # Calculate group statistics group_stats <- aggregate(   cbind(value1, value2) ~ group,    data = complex_data,    FUN = function(x) c(mean = mean(x), sd = sd(x)) )  print(group_stats) #>   group value1.mean value1.sd value2.mean value2.sd #> 1     A   101.61247  14.63952   51.727220 10.047051 #> 2     B    98.13191  13.84514   53.261796  8.934998

title: Advanced Quarto Article
text: Quarto supports code annotations detailed explanations: 1 Load sample data 2 Create simple numeric vector 3 Apply example function package 4 Display results
code: 1 2data <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) 3result <- example_function(data) 4print(result) #> [1] 3

title: Advanced Quarto Article
text: Package workflow diagram
code: flowchart LR     A[Input Data] --> B[Validate]     B --> C[Process]     C --> D[Output Results]     D --> E[Visualize]

title: Advanced Quarto Article
text: Quarto excels mathematical notation. ’s example statistical formula: standard error mean calculated : SE=sn SE = \frac{s}{\sqrt{n}} ss sample standard deviation nn sample size. confidence interval: CI=x‾±tα/2,n−1⋅SE CI = \bar{x} \pm t_{\alpha/2, n-1} \cdot SE

title: Advanced Quarto Article
text: Expanding tip section Click expand section additional tips: Use descriptive chunk labels better organization Set global chunk options beginning Use cross-references link related content Leverage callouts important information Consider code folding long code blocks

title: Quarto Vignette Example
text: vignette demonstrates use Quarto (.qmd) files vignettes R packages. Quarto next-generation version R Markdown, offering enhanced features better integration multiple programming languages.

title: Quarto Vignette Example
text: Quarto offers several advantages traditional R Markdown: Enhanced features: Better support cross-references, callouts, advanced formatting Multiple engines: Works R, Python, Julia, Observable Modern syntax: Cleaner YAML chunk options using #| syntax Better publishing: Improved website book publishing capabilities

title: Copilot Instructions for R Package Template
text: CRITICAL: committing code changes requesting review, ALWAYS run following validation commands locally: lintr::lint_package() - Check code style identify linting issues devtools::document() - Generate/update documentation roxygen2 comments devtools::test() - Run test suites ensure tests pass devtools::check() - Run R CMD check validate package structure compliance pkgdown::build_site() - MANDATORY: Build full pkgdown website locally inspect output ensure documentation renders correctly, including vignettes, articles, special formats (e.g., RevealJS presentations) commands must run order must pass without errors pushing changes requesting code review. ensures CI/CD workflows pass prevents wasting reviewer time fixable issues. IMPORTANT: changes affecting documentation vignettes, MUST build visually inspect pkgdown site output (located docs/) verify everything renders expected. especially critical multi-format documents custom output formats.

title: Copilot Instructions for R Package Template
code: # Complete validation sequence before committing devtools::document()    # Update documentation devtools::test()        # Verify all tests pass devtools::check()       # Run full package check lintr::lint_package()   # Verify code style pkgdown::build_site()   # Build pkgdown site to verify documentation  # Manually inspect docs/ directory to verify rendering # Check docs/articles/*.html for correct output # Verify links, images, and special formats work correctly  # Only commit and push if all checks pass AND visual inspection confirms correct rendering

title: Copilot Instructions for R Package Template
text: R/ - R source files tests/testthat/ - Unit tests man/ - Documentation (auto-generated) vignettes/ - Long-form documentation data/ - Package data data-raw/ - Scripts generate package data inst/ - Additional files include package .github/ - GitHub Actions workflows templates

title: Copilot Instructions for R Package Template
text: Follow tidyverse style guide Use roxygen2 documentation Include tests exported functions Use (#issue_number) notation link issues (e.g., (#123)) Use (#PR_number) notation link pull requests Use @username credit external contributors (internal team members) See R Packages - NEWS.md details

what: Using Pipes to Emphasize Primary Inputs
title: Copilot Instructions for R Package Template
text: Use pipes (|> %>%) emphasize primary input make sequences actions readable: Use pipes sequences: applying multiple transformations single primary object (typically data frame), use pipes show flow data transformations Emphasize main subject: Pipes keep focus primary input placing start pipeline Avoid multiple objects: Don’t use pipes multiple unrelated objects involved; use direct function calls intermediate variables instead Add space pipe operator Place step new line multi-step pipelines Indent continuation lines clarity Example: details, see tidyverse style guide pipes.
code: # Good: Pipe emphasizes the primary input (iris) and the sequence of transformations iris |>   summarize(across(where(is.numeric), mean), .by = Species) |>   pivot_longer(!Species, names_to = "measure", values_to = "value") |>   arrange(value)  # Less clear: Nested functions obscure the flow arrange(   pivot_longer(     summarize(iris, across(where(is.numeric), mean), .by = Species),     !Species, names_to = "measure", values_to = "value"   ),   value )

title: Copilot Instructions for R Package Template
text: Follow guidance provided UCD-SERG Lab Manual. corresponding source files available github.com/UCD-SERG/lab-manual easier read.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: building pkgdown documentation site pkgdown::build_site(), function needs download external JavaScript CSS dependencies CDNs (Content Delivery Networks). ’re working restricted network environment, ’ll need ensure access following CDNs: https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ - headroom.js (sticky header functionality) https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/ - bootstrap-toc.js (table contents) Bootstrap dependencies Without access CDNs, pkgdown::build_site() fail errors like: dependencies automatically cached first download, subsequent builds faster won’t require network access unless cache cleared.
code: Error: cannot open URL 'https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/headroom/0.11.0/headroom.min.js'
